Q: How to calculate Depth Information from USB 3.0 Stereo Camera? A:

This code worked for my leopard imaging LI-USB30-V024 STEREO camera:

import cv2
import numpy as np

# 1. Open with V4L2
cap = cv2.VideoCapture(2, cv2.CAP_V4L2) #2 is my video location

# 2. Stop OpenCV from converting to BGR
cap.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_CONVERT_RGB, 0)

while True:
    ret, frame = cap.read()
    if not ret:
        break

    # At this point, 'frame' is a raw buffer. 
    # Because it was 'YUYV' (16-bit per pixel), OpenCV likely 
    # shaped it as (H, W, 2).
    
    # Let's split the 16-bit "YUYV" pixel into two 8-bit images
    # Frame[:, :, 0] is the 'Y' channel (Camera A)
    # Frame[:, :, 1] is the 'U/V' channel (Camera B)
    cam_a_raw = frame[:, :, 0]
    cam_b_raw = frame[:, :, 1]

    # Now you have two separate grayscale images from your two sensors
    cv2.imshow('Sensor A (High 8-bit)', cam_a_raw)
    cv2.imshow('Sensor B (Low 8-bit)', cam_b_raw)

    if cv2.waitKey(1) == ord('q'):
        break

cap.release()
cv2.destroyAllWindows()

Q: linkedin oauth authorization fails with "Bummer, something went wrong" A: 
https://www.linkedin.com/oauth/v2/authorization?response_type=code&client_id=${process.env.REACT_APP_LinkedInClientID}&redirect_uri=${process.env.REACT_APP_MY_URL}/linkcheck&state=random&scope=profile%20email

Changing scope name to 'profile' and 'email' worked for me

Q: How to center the title and an image in streamlit? A:

Using horizontal_alignment='center' of st.container:

import streamlit as st

with st.container(horizontal_alignment='center'):
    st.title('Headline',width='content')
    st.image("https://static.streamlit.io/examples/cat.jpg")

Output:

Sidenote: st.title v.1.52+ supports text_alignment:

st.title("This is a title", text_alignment='center')

Q: How Do I Force Ansible To Always Run A Task A:

How can I force Ansible to not check and always run the task?

Depending on the tasks (annot. which are not given or described in your question), to do so you may need to set one or more out of

when: true
check_mode: false
tags: always
